segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10
17. With Jāṇussoṇi
169. With Saṅgārava

segments.pli: Atha kho saṅgāravo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then Saṅgārava the brahmin went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho saṅgāravo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho gotama, orimaṃ tīraṃ, kiṃ pārimaṃ tīran”ti?
segments.en: “Master Gotama, what is the near shore? And what is the far shore?”

segments.pli: “Pāṇātipāto kho, brāhmaṇa, orimaṃ tīraṃ, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: “Killing living creatures is the near shore, brahmin, and not killing living creatures is the far shore.

segments.pli: Adinnādānaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, orimaṃ tīraṃ, adinnādānā veramaṇī pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Stealing is the near shore, and not stealing is the far shore.

segments.pli: Kāmesumicchācāro orimaṃ tīraṃ, kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Sexual misconduct is the near shore, and avoiding sexual misconduct is the far shore.

segments.pli: Musāvādo orimaṃ tīraṃ, musāvādā veramaṇī pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Lying is the near shore, and not lying is the far shore.

segments.pli: Pisuṇā vācā orimaṃ tīraṃ, pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Divisive speech is the near shore, and avoiding divisive speech is the far shore.

segments.pli: Pharusā vācā orimaṃ tīraṃ, pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Harsh speech is the near shore, and avoiding harsh speech is the far shore.

segments.pli: Samphappalāpo orimaṃ tīraṃ, samphappalāpā veramaṇī pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Talking nonsense is the near shore, and avoiding talking nonsense is the far shore.

segments.pli: Abhijjhā orimaṃ tīraṃ, anabhijjhā pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Covetousness is the near shore, and contentment is the far shore.

segments.pli: Byāpādo orimaṃ tīraṃ, abyāpādo pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Ill will is the near shore, and good will is the far shore.

segments.pli: Micchādiṭṭhi orimaṃ tīraṃ, sammādiṭṭhi pārimaṃ tīraṃ.
segments.en: Wrong view is the near shore, and right view is the far shore.

segments.pli: Idaṃ kho, brāhmaṇa, orimaṃ tīraṃ, idaṃ pārimaṃ tīranti.
segments.en: This is the near shore, and this is the far shore.
Few are those among humans
who cross to the far shore.
The rest just run
around on the near shore.
When the teaching is well explained,
those who practice accordingly
are the ones who will cross over
Death’s domain so hard to pass.
Rid of dark qualities,
an astute person should develop the bright.
Leaving home behind
for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
you should try to find delight there,
having left behind sensual pleasures.
With no possessions, an astute person
should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
And those whose minds are rightly developed
in the awakening factors;
letting go of attachments,
they delight in not grasping.
With defilements ended, brilliant,
they are extinguished in this world.”

sections.title: Then Saṅgārava the brahmin went up to the Buddha,…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha teaches the brahmin Saṅgārava that the wrong path is the near shore where most people dwell; the right path is the far shore, where few have crossed over.
